subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Two or more structures are said to be homologous if they are alike
because of shared ancestry. Ovaries and testes share a developmental ancestry, meaning that
the structures arose from the same tissue in what physical stage of human life?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
All Homo sapiens are thought to share a common matrilineage.
What genetic information has been used as key evidence for this shared matrilineage?
W) Mitochondrial (read as: my-toh-KOHN-dree-ahl) DNA
X) Nuclear DNA
Y) Plasma membranes
Z) Cytoplasmic tRNA

subject: MATH
content:
Given a standard deck of 52 cards, what is the probability, expressed
as a fraction in lowest terms, that the first card dealt is a heart?

subject: MATH
content:
An ichthyologist wants to know the fish population of a pond. She
catches 60 fish, tags them, and releases them. Two weeks later, she catches 50 fish and 7 of
them have tags. Based on the data, what is the best estimate of the fish population of the pond?
Round your answer to the nearest hundred.

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
In which of the following sedimentary environments
would a dominantly organic sedimentary rock most likely be formed?
W) Shallow marine
X) Deep ocean
Y) Wind-blown desert
Z) Glacial outwash plain

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
A high-energy river environment will most likely create
which of the following deposits:
W) Laminar silt beds
X) Course-grained, angular cross bedding
Y) Poorly sorted beds with no structure
Z) Well rounded gravels

subject: MATH
content:
What do we call a mathematical object that possesses both magnitude
and direction?

subject: MATH
content:
If b is a negative vector of a given vector a, then how do b and a
compare?
W) a has a smaller magnitude than b
X) b has a smaller magnitude than a
Y) b has the same magnitude as a, applied in the opposite direction
Z) b has a larger magnitude than a, applied in the opposite direction
answer:
Y) B HAS THE SAME MAGNITUDE AS A, APPLIED IN THE OPPOSITE
DIRECTION

subject: CHEMISTRY
content: What letter designates the lowest energy subshell in any shell?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Identify the scientist who proposed the existence of energy
levels for the electrons in an atom.

subject: PHYSICS
content:
What causes low-pressure weather systems, such as tropical
cyclones, to spin counter-clockwise in the Northern Hemisphere and clockwise in the Southern
Hemisphere?
answer: CORIOLIS EFFECT (ACCEPT: CORIOLIS FORCE, ROTATION OF THE EARTH)

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Billions of tiny ice crystals rub together to produce electron
imbalances within storm clouds. What do we see when electrons arc to another cloud or to the
ground?

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
Which of the following minerals could be mined to
create electrical wiring?
W) Chalcopyrite (read as: kahl-koh-PY-ryt)
X) Limestone
Y) Galena (read as: gah-LEE-nah)
Z) Gypsum

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
Which of the following is the most abundant mineral
group found in the Earth's crust?
W) Carbonates
X) Oxides
Y) Sulfides
Z) Silicates

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Most shelled organisms in the ocean make their shells out of
calcium carbonate. What effect would increasing ocean acidity have on the shells of these
organisms?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
In the 1960s, a group of bacteria were discovered with magnetic
crystals in a specialized organelle. It is believed that these bacteria used the crystals to help
them align with what natural phenomenon?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following is a common ion?
W) Na2+
X) Al3+
Y) B2+
Z) Kr2+

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following has an electron configuration of 1s2 2s2
2p6 3s2 3p6 (read as: 1 s 2, 2 s 2, 2 p 6, 3 s 2, 3 p 6)?
W) Sodium ion
X) Chlorine
Y) Neon
Z) Calcium ion

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
In humans, where does the organ responsible for balance
reside?
W) Inner ear
X) Middle ear
Y) Outer ear
Z) Hypothalamus

subject: BIOLOGY
content: What is a common name for adipose tissue?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
What is the term that describes the separation of visible light into
its component colors by a prism?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Which of the following colors of light has the most energy?
W) Yellow
X) Red
Y) Green
Z) Violet

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
Which of the following is NOT considered a
component of the modern theory of ice ages?
W) The Earth wobbles on its axis
X) The tilt of the Earth varies
Y) Plate tectonics causes Earth's equator to change location
Z) The Earth's orbit around the Sun varies
answer: Y) PLATE TECTONICS CAUSE EARTH'S EQUATOR TO CHANGE LOCATION

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
Isostatic rebound following the end of the most
recent ice age caused which of the following?
W) Localized sea level rise
X) Localized sea level drop
Y) Mountain formation in the eastern part of the U.S.
Z) Volcanism in Southern Mexico

subject: MATH
content:
The point (1, 2) is reflected across the x axis. What are the
coordinates of its image?

subject: MATH
content:
A viper had a length of 30 centimeters at 6 months of age and a
length of 1.3 meters at 15 years old. Assuming that its growth was linear, which of the following
is closest to its length in meters at 10 years old?
W) 0.6
X) 0.8
Y) 1
Z) 1.2

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
What characteristic has made angiosperms so successful
during the last 140 million years?
W) They are very tall, outcompeting other plants for sunlight
X) They have flowers to attract pollinators
Y) They are thorny to deter herbivores from consuming them
Z) They are the only plants that can reproduce asexually
answer: X) THEY HAVE FLOWERS TO ATTRACT POLLINATORS

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Fruits primarily function in order to entice animals to eat them.
In what way does this benefit the fruiting plant?
W) Animals disperse the seeds
X) Animals pollinate while eating the fruits
Y) Animals eat the fruit instead of other parts of the plant
Z) There is no benefit to the plant

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following is true about the alpha particle?
W) It is a hydrogen atom
X) It was discovered by J.J. Thomson
Y) It was used by Ernest Rutherford in experiments relating to the nucleus of the atom
Z) It is purely electromagnetic radiation
answer:
Y) IT WAS USED BY ERNEST RUTHERFORD IN EXPERIMENTS RELATING TO
THE NUCLEUS OF THE ATOM

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
What term best describes the type of reaction that converts
uranium in the soil to radon?
W) Acid-base
X) Fusion
Y) Electromagnetic radiation
Z) Radioactive decay

subject: PHYSICS
content:
A child is holding a string with a yo-yo dangling at the bottom of
it. As the child yanks the string up, the tension in the string will:
W) Decrease
X) Increase
Y) Stay the same
Z) Become negative

subject: PHYSICS
content:
When a girl wearing roller blades throws a ball in front of her, she
slides backwards. Her movement is an illustration of which of Newton’s Laws of Motion?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
What is the process that best describes the transfer of
electrons from one atom to another through electrostatic attraction?
W) Ionic bonding
X) Repulsion
Y) Nuclear force
Z) Covalent bonding

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
The force between two electrically charged objects can be
changed by altering what two quantities?
answer:
THE AMOUNT OF CHARGE AND THE DISTANCE BETWEEN THE OBJECTS
________________________________________________________________________

subject: MATH
content: If 8x3 – 4y = -16x, express y as a function of x in simplest form.

subject: MATH
content:
Solve the quadratic equation 3x2 +2x−8=0.
W) x =2 or −4
X) x =8 or −12
Y) x = −2 or 4/3
Z) x =8 or −4/3

subject: ENERGY
content:
What kind of potential energy is stored in the reservoir behind a
dam?

subject: ENERGY
content:
Which of the following is NOT a significant limitation to the
further development of U.S. hydropower?
W) Availability of sites for new large hydro facilities
X) Regulatory requirements
Y) Maintenance costs
Z) Environmental concerns

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content: In what year did astronauts first land on the Moon?

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
NASA’s Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter, which
reached lunar orbit in June of 2009, has gathered digital information about the moon. Which of
the following has NOT been observed by LRO?
W) The far side of the moon is rougher and has more craters than the near side
X) Cliffs in the lunar crust indicate that the moon has expanded in the recent past
Y) Astronaut landing sites
Z) Lunar rilles, which look like river channels
answer:
X) CLIFFS IN THE LUNAR CRUST INDICATE THAT THE MOON HAS EXPANDED
IN THE RECENT PAST

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Providing your answer to the nearest degree, what is absolute
zero in degrees Celsius?
answer: -273 DEGREES CELSIUS (ACCEPT: 273 DEGREES CELSIUS BELOW ZERO)

subject: PHYSICS
content: When air in a closed system is heated, what does it do?

subject: ENERGY
content:
Which of the following devices stores electrical energy in
chemical form in order to release it slowly through a circuit?
W) Inductor
X) Resistor
Y) Capacitor
Z) Battery

subject: ENERGY
content:
Which of the following types of battery is most commonly used in
automobiles?
W) Lithium-ion (read as: LI-thee-uhm)
X) Nickel Cadmium
Y) Lead-acid
Z) Zinc chloride

subject: MATH
content:
Determine the slope of the line that has the equation:
y – 14 = 7 (x + 2) - 5.

subject: MATH
content:
Line 1 and line 2 are parallel. If line 1 contains the points (6, 13)
and (4, 11) and line 2 contains the point (8, 20), determine which of the following points lies on
line 2.
W) (12, 15)
X) (18, 10)
Y) (10, -12)
Z) (14, 26)

subject: ENERGY
content:
Which of the following is a renewable resource?
W) Diamonds
X) Wood
Y) Coal
Z) Propane

subject: ENERGY
content:
Which of the following choices describes one reason why the
greenhouse effect is important?
W) It warms the Earth to a temperature necessary for life on Earth
X) It allows solar radiation to escape, preventing extreme radiation
Y) It cools the Earth to a temperature necessary for life on Earth
Z) It creates nitrogen for Earth’s atmosphere
answer:
W) IT WARMS THE EARTH TO A TEMPERATURE NECESSARY FOR LIFE ON
EARTH

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
Why is the Kepler telescope unique?
W) It is pointed at one specific target
X) It is focused on a large section of the sky
Y) It is scanning the entire sky
Z) It generates a small amount of data
answer: X) IT IS FOCUSED ON A LARGE SECTION OF THE SKY

subject: EARTH AND SPACE
content:
What are scientists hoping to discover with the Kepler
telescope?
